intro: Pedilanthus grisebachii, commonly known as the gray pedilanthus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and striking, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Pedilanthus grisebachii is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
